Dear Ms. Lessnau:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
February 24, 2022. Due to the violation of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also
violations of the ISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from
the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or ISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (269) 337-5289.
Sincerely,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4152 Initial documentation.
At the time of admission, all of the following shall be in the
resident's case record:
(c) A brief description of the resident's preparation for
placement and general physical and emotional state at the
time of admission.
Three of three open files did not have a brief description of how the youths were
prepared for placement by Christ Child staff.
2.) The facility is in compliance will all additional ISEP requirements.
3.) The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
I provided ideas on ways to comply with changes in the incident reporting rule.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
I trained Clinical Director on what belongs in the social work contacts and child
status sections of treatment plans.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Christ Child House has been proactive and already revised a number of their policies,
so they are consistent with the new CCI rules expected to take effect in March 2022.
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period. However, there were two incidents of substantiated corporal
punishment for which the facility submitted two acceptable corrective action
plans.
The first incident involved a staff person hitting a ball out of a youth’s hands, pushing
him on the shoulder and failing to write an incident report. The corrective action plan
involved the staff being suspended for five days with an agreement of immediate
1

termination if he shows further behavior of this type. The staff also received verbal
discipline with discussions about conduct, discipline, restraints, and incident report
writing.
The second incident involved a different staff person pushing a youth on his chest.
The corrective action plan involved a two-week suspension with an agreement of
immediate termination if the staff shows further behavior of this type and performance
evaluations every 90 days for the next year.
The facility submitted one acceptable corrective action plan unrelated to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
This related to its 2021 Renewal Inspection with the following violations:
R 400.4142 Health services: policies and procedures (1) (e) Dispensing medication
R 400.4144 Admission health screening; physical examinations (1)
R 400.4166 Discharge plan (1) (e )
The agency was successful with this corrective action plan and did not receive repeat
violations this inspection.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the facility continue on their regular license.
